trans-unit.source: Retrieves the bits of the specified bitmap and copies them into a buffer as a DIB

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves the bits of the specified bitmap and copies them into a buffer as a DIB

target.mrk: Retrieves the bits of the specified bitmap and copies them into a buffer as a DIB

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle to the device context

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the device context

target.mrk: Handle to the device context

trans-unit.source: Handle to the bitmap. This must be a compatible bitmap (DDB).

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the bitmap.
This must be a compatible bitmap (DDB).

target.mrk: Handle to the bitmap.
This must be a compatible bitmap (DDB).

trans-unit.source: Specifies the first scan line to retrieve

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the first scan line to retrieve

target.mrk: Specifies the first scan line to retrieve

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of scan lines to retrieve

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the number of scan lines to retrieve

target.mrk: Specifies the number of scan lines to retrieve

trans-unit.source: Pointer to a buffer to receive the bitmap data.

seg-source.mrk: Pointer to a buffer to receive the bitmap data.

target.mrk: Pointer to a buffer to receive the bitmap data.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is 0, the function passes the dimensions and format of the bitmap to the $tagBITMAPINFO structure pointed to by the $tBI parameter.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is 0, the function passes the dimensions and format of the bitmap to the $tagBITMAPINFO structure pointed to by the $tBI parameter.

target.mrk: If this parameter is 0, the function passes the dimensions and format of the bitmap to the $tagBITMAPINFO structure pointed to by the $tBI parameter.

trans-unit.source: A $tagBITMAPINFO structure or a pointer to it that specifies the desired format for the DIB data

seg-source.mrk: A $tagBITMAPINFO structure or a pointer to it that specifies the desired format for the DIB data

target.mrk: A $tagBITMAPINFO structure or a pointer to it that specifies the desired format for the DIB data

trans-unit.source: Specifies the format of the bmiColors member of the $tagBITMAPINFO structure.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the format of the bmiColors member of the $tagBITMAPINFO structure.

target.mrk: Specifies the format of the bmiColors member of the $tagBITMAPINFO structure.

trans-unit.source: It must be one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: It must be one of the following values:

target.mrk: It must be one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: $DIB_PAL_COLORS - The color table should consist of an array of 16-bit indexes into the current palette

seg-source.mrk: $DIB_PAL_COLORS - The color table should consist of an array of 16-bit indexes into the current palette

target.mrk: $DIB_PAL_COLORS - The color table should consist of an array of 16-bit indexes into the current palette

trans-unit.source: $DIB_RGB_COLORS - The color table should consist of literal red, green, blue values

seg-source.mrk: $DIB_RGB_COLORS - The color table should consist of literal red, green, blue values

target.mrk: $DIB_RGB_COLORS - The color table should consist of literal red, green, blue values

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: If $pBits is not 0 and the function succeeds, the return value is the number of scan lines copied from the bitmap.

seg-source.mrk: If $pBits is not 0 and the function succeeds, the return value is the number of scan lines copied from the bitmap.

target.mrk: If $pBits is not 0 and the function succeeds, the return value is the number of scan lines copied from the bitmap.

trans-unit.source: If $pBits is 0 and GetDIBits successfully fills the structure, the return value is True.

seg-source.mrk: If $pBits is 0 and GetDIBits successfully fills the structure, the return value is True.

target.mrk: If $pBits is 0 and GetDIBits successfully fills the structure, the return value is True.

trans-unit.source: False

seg-source.mrk: False

target.mrk: False
